sources.data_found: Caviness cluster (as of documentation): 367 compute nodes, 15104 traditional CPU cores, 49 GPUs, 121 TiB of RAM and 238 TB of NFS storage.
DARWIN has 105 compute nodes with a total of 6672 cores, 22 GPUs, 100TB of memory, and 1.2PB of disk storage.
Sauron GPU cluster: 96 NVIDIA Fermi S2070 GPU systems (96 × S2070 GPUs) attached to 45 computational nodes.

During the 2021-2022 academic year, University of Delaware handed out 150 bachelor's degrees in computer & information sciences. In 2022, 67 students received their master's degree in computer & information sciences from UD. In addition, 9 students received their doctoral degrees in computer & information sciences in 2022.
103 Total Graduate Students in Computer Science department

student_data.notes: Undergrad count estimated from 150 bachelor's degrees awarded in 2021-2022, assuming typical 4-year program (150 × 4 = 600). MS count based on 67 master's degrees awarded in 2022. PhD count estimated from 9 doctoral degrees awarded in 2022 and assuming 4-year average time to degree (9 × 4 = 36).

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Sauron cluster has 96 Fermi S2070 GPU systems. Very old generation (2011 era).
Caviness cluster: 49 GPUs (models not specified); DARWIN: 22 GPUs (models not specified). Total = 49 + 22 = 71 GPUs of unknown models.

gpu_resources.notes:
CLUSTERS FOUND:

1) Caviness cluster: 49 GPUs total, but specific models not documented in sources found. This is UD's third community cluster.

2) DARWIN cluster: 22 GPUs total, but specific models not documented in sources found.

3) Sauron cluster (CIS department): 96 NVIDIA Tesla S2070 GPUs (Fermi generation, circa 2011). This is very old hardware.

TOTAL GPUs: 96 (S2070) + 49 (Caviness) + 22 (DARWIN) = 167 GPUs total.

NOTE: No modern GPUs (H100, A100, V100, etc.) were found in the available documentation. The university appears to be using older GPU infrastructure, with the newest clusters (Caviness and DARWIN) not specifying GPU models in public documentation.

analysis_notes: University of Delaware appears to have limited modern GPU infrastructure compared to peer research universities. The only specifically identified GPUs are 96 Tesla S2070s from 2011. While Caviness (49 GPUs) and DARWIN (22 GPUs) clusters exist, their GPU models are not publicly documented. Student counts are based on degrees awarded data, with undergraduate enrollment estimated using standard program duration assumptions.
